response:
<<<api>>>: PrintWriter.write
<<<code>>>: try { printWriter.write("1"); } catch (Exception e) { e.printStackTrace(); }
<<<explanation>>>: The problem is that you are writing string without a line break. But BufferedReader expects one of the line characters mentioned above which you are not providing. It does output the whole buffer once the end of the stream is reached though.

Regarding your second question, you can use the `select` method with a CSS selector to select the specific tag you want. For example, if you want to select only the paragraphs with a "dir" attribute set to "rtl", you can use the following code:
```less
Elements ps = doc.select("p[dir='rtl']");
```
This should select only the paragraphs with the specified attribute, and you should be able to extract the desired text without the unwanted text.
